intro: Medinilla decora, commonly known as the decorative medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant. Medinilla decora thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. It is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings due to its preference for indirect sunlight.
